name: roman
description: The gods of Olympus make themselves known with the gentle lap of waves against the shores and the crash of the thunder among the cloud–enshrouded peaks. The thick boar–infested woods and the sere, olive–covered hillsides hold evidence of their passing. Every aspect of nature echoes with their presence, and they’ve made a place for themselves inside the human heart, too.

gods.name: zoos
gods.description: zoos is the leader of the Roman gods, and lives atop Mount Olympus, where he rules over the mortal world below.
gods.appearance: zoos is depicted as a regal, mature man with a sturdy figure and dark beard grasping a lightning bolt and wreathed in a crown of olive leaves.

quotes.description: Bear up, my child, bear up; zoos who oversees and directs all things is still mighty in heaven.
quotes.author: Sophocles

combat.title: Military Prowess
combat.description: zoos famously led the Roman gods in the battle against the Titans, and is a fearsome foe. He calls down electric energy and fashions them into mighty spears of lightning to hurl at his enemies.

children.title: Aegis
children.description: The Aegis bears the head of a Gorgon, and makes a terrible roaring sound in battle.

gods.realm: Olympus, where he rules over all.

followers.description: zoos is followed by many, of all different race and creed.

children.title: Oaths
children.description: A promise or an oath is a sacred bond that should not be broken.

gods.name: posighdon
titles: God of the Sea and Earthquakes
gods.description: posighdon is the god of the Sea - all things underwater are under his purview
gods.appearance: a mature man with a sturdy build and a dark beard holding a trident and a sea-creature encrusted boulder, simply crowned with a headband with a cloak draped around his arms.

children.title: posighdon's Trident
children.description: posighdon's trident was so powerful that it could shake the lands.

gods.realm: a palace underneath the sea, watching over the fishermen from below.

followers.description: posighdon is followed by many mariners, fishermen, and horse riders.

children.title: smooth sailing
children.description: posighdon will bless sailors and those that have earnt his favour with smooth passage.

children.title: management of horses
children.description: As the Lord of Horses, posighdon can calm equines as easily as he can enrage them.

children.title: mad horses
children.description: As the Lord of Horses, posighdon can enrage equines as easily as he can calm them.

children.title: stormy seas
children.description: Those that tempt posighdon's wrath risk stormy seas on their next voyage.

gods.name: haydes
gods.description: haydes is the god of the Dead and the first son of Kronos. However when He, zoos and posighdon were drawing lots for the division of the cosmos, haydes gained dominion of the Underworld, where he rules over the dead.
gods.appearance: a dark-bearded, regal god, with a bird tipped sceptre with Cerebus seated by his throne.

children.title: Sceptre
children.description: A powerful relic that is able to create a passage between the worlds of the living and the dead

children.title: Cap of Invisibility
children.description: A cap which can turn the wearer invisible

gods.realm: the Underworld. As far below the earth as the heavens are above, haydes' realm is a dark and depressing place.

followers.description: haydes, as the god of the dead, was a fearsome figure to those still living; in no hurry to meet him, they were reluctant to swear oaths in his name, and averted their faces when sacrificing to him. Since to many, simply to say the word "haydes" was frightening, euphemisms were pressed into use.

children.title: second to last day of every month
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

children.title: plenty from the earth
children.description: As the lord of the underworld, haydes has considerable wealth, and can bestow riches to those he deems worthy.

children.title: the ability to go un-noticed
children.description: haydes can give those that wish to be unseen the power to avoid detection in the dark.

gods.name: Aphrodite
gods.description: Aphrodite is the goddess of love and scorns those who stay away from relationships. Her love can be a thing of beauty or a thing of terror and destruction.
gods.appearance: Aphrodite is consistently portrayed as a nubile, infinitely desirable adult, having had no childhood.

children.title: A Darker Side
children.description: While Aphrodite is most well known as the goddess of Love, she is also known as a goddess of War - especially by people like the Spartans.

children.title: Girdle
children.description: The Girdle inspires desire in all those who look upon the wearer

followers.description: As the goddess of beauty and love the favour of Aphrodite was worshipped by all people, though especially by prostitutes.

children.title: the fourth day of every month
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

avatars.title: Aphrodite Areia
avatars.description: Aphrodite Areia is a war-like aspect of Aphrodite. She appears clad in armour and bearing weapons and is worshipped by the Spartans and other war-loving people. Aphrodite is ready to use deciptive strategies, such as how she lured the Gigantes one by one into a cave for them to be murdered

gods.name: Artemis
titles: Goddess of the Flocks and the Chase
gods.description: Artemis is the goddess of the Hunt and young girls. She can change others into animals as punishment for transgressions against her and she demands appropriate respect from mortals.
gods.appearance: a young woman wearing a short costume that leaves her legs free and wielding a bow with a quiver of arrows.
portfolios: sudden death and disease of girls

children.title: A Dangerous Hunter
children.description: Artemis is quick to strike down those who offend her with animals and wild beasts. She is a dedicated huntress and will pursue her quarry until it is caught.

children.title: Bow of Artemis
children.description: The Bow of Artemis was forged by the Cyclopses

followers.description: Artemis is worshipped by Hunters and Women, young girls could be expected to serve Artemis until they come of age.

children.title: the sixth day of the week
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

children.title: chastity
children.description: Artemis and her followers value chastity above all else.

children.title: transformation into a wild animal
children.description: As goddess of the hunt, Artemis can transform those that wrong her into wild animas to be hunted.

gods.name: Apollo
gods.description: The twin brother of Artemis, Apollo is the inventor of music. Those that he loves and loses or those that he hates can find themselves transformed and immortalised as a part of nature.
gods.appearance: a handsome youth, beardless with long hair and holds either a lyre or a bow.
portfolios: sudden death and diseases of boys

children.title: The Lyre of Apollo
children.description:
When Hermes was a baby, he stole a number of Apollo's Cattle and took them to a cave in the woods near Pylos. In the cave, he found a tortoise and killed it, then removed the insides. He used one of the cow's intestines and the tortoise shell and made the first lyre. 
 Apollo eventually found Hermes, but fell in love with the sound the lyre made. Apollo gifted the cattle to Hermes in exchange for the lyre and forgave Hermes for stealing his cattle.

children.title: Bow of Apollo
children.description: The bow of Apollo fires arrows and plagues upon those who anger him

followers.description: Oracles are often followers of Apollo, the Greatest of which is the Pythia of Delph, the high priestess of Apollo

gods.name: Athena
titles: The Contriver of Plans and Devices
gods.description: Athena is a wise goddess and protects those that follow her. She does have the rage of a goddess, and affronts to her are paid back with divine retribution.
gods.appearance: a stately woman wearing a helmet armed with a spear and Aegis

followers.description: Athena is the goddess of Craftsment, Wisdom and Heroes.

gods.name: Dionysus
gods.description: Dionysus is the god of Wine and Theatre, his revelry is open to all. However, he has his dark side - he is the god of madness the anger of Dionysus is a terrifying thing
gods.appearance: long haired youth, almost effeminate in appearance. He holds a staff topped with a pinecone and brings revelry with him

followers.description: Dionysus is a god of the people and youths. Those who value proper decorum and modesty are apallled at the revelry of the Bacchic crowds. Devotees of Dionysus may engage in the rending of animals with their bare hands

children.title: Eighth Month of the Year
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

gods.name: dametre
gods.description: dametre is the goddess of Agriculture - her favour promised a bountiful harvest and more grain then could be eaten. However her anger promised frosts and famine.
gods.appearance: a mature woman wearing a crown holding wheat in a cornocopia and a torch

followers.description: As the goddess of Agriculture, dametre has a dedictated following among anyone who farmed. She was also a major figure of worship in the Eleusinian mysteries, which promised a better afterlife to its followers.

gods.name: Hermes
gods.description: Hermes is the hessenger of the gods and the personal messenger of zoos. He brings the souls of the deceased to the edge of the underworld, where they are ferried deeper by the Cthonic gods
gods.appearance: an athletic man wearing winged boots, full of energy. Ontop of his head is a helmet with two wings attached.

children.title: Talaria
children.description: Tarlaria is the name of a pair of winged boots forged by Hephaestus.

children.title: Golden Blade
children.description: His weapon was a sword of gold, which killed Argos; lent to Perseus to kill Medusa.

children.title: Winged Helm
children.description: A Petasos with wings, Hermes' helmet was forged by Hephaestus.

followers.description: Hermes was the messenger of zoos, and his followers were all those that valued speed. Additionally, travelers, traders, and thieves worshiped him.

relationships.name: Aphroditus
relationships.description: Aphrodite gave birth to Hermaphroditus, or Aphroditus, the god of androgyny.

gods.name: Hera
gods.description: Hera is the Queen of the gods, forever tested by her husband zoos. Unable to attack zoos, her anger is often directed to his consorts or his children.
gods.appearance: a beautiful woman wearing a crown and holding a royal, lotus-tipped sceptre

relationships.name: Hephaestus
relationships.description: Hera gave birth to Hephaestus without male intervention.

gods.name: Ares
gods.appearance: always clad in armour, holding weapons and ready for battle. He can appear as the fresh-faced youth or the grizzeled veteran depending on his mood.

children.title: Odikinesis
children.description: Possessing the ability to manipulate feelings and emotions of war such as hate and rage, Ares would induce strife before battles.

children.title: Strength
children.description: As a fighter, Ares excelled at all to do with physicality.

children.title: Bloodlust
children.description: As the God of War, Ares has plenty of experience in battle. In contrast to Athena, who is the goddess of tacticians, Ares represents a more brutal, carnal type of conquest.

followers.description: Ares is the god of war and courage - cities and countries going to war would worship Ares before going into battle

gods.name: Hestia
gods.description: Hestia is the First-born child of Kronos and Rhea and the first to be swallowed by him. After Apollo and posighdon vied for her hand in marriage she refused and chose to be an eternal virgin.
gods.appearance: a beautiful veiled woman, with long dark hair

children.title: De-escalation
children.description: Hestia finds combat distasteful, and will try and defuse the situation before it gets out of hand.

gods.name: Hephaestus
gods.appearance: bearded man with twisted legs

followers.description: Hephaestus is the god of the forge. He is worshipped by Craftsmen and his blessing gives them inspiration and skill,

gods.name: Persephone
gods.appearance: a beautiful young maiden with fair skin. Her face is the epitome of young beauty. She is often shown in long, flowing clothing with a wreath of flowers around her head.

followers.description: Persephone was a goddess of Spring and the Wife of haydes. Her favour might ensure a better afterlife for her worshippers.

gods.name: Hecate
gods.appearance: a woman wearing a crown. Sometimes, she has three bodies, conjoined to one another.

followers.description: Hecate is a mysterious Goddess who is a master of the Arcane Arts and lives in the Underworld, her followers ask for her secret knowledge.

gods.name: Nike
gods.appearance: an athletic woman with two large wings.

followers.description: The Favour of Nike is a promise of victory, though it was rarely given without being earnt.

gods.name: Tyche
gods.appearance: a woman with a crown, often shown holding a horn of cornucopia.

gods.name: Hebe
gods.description: Hebe is the daughter of zoos and Hera, as well as the Goddess of Youth. She served as the Cupbearer of the Gods, and was later married to Herakles, the protector of Olympus.
gods.appearance: a woman in a sleeveless dress, with long brown hair.

children.title: Fountain of Youth
children.description: Hebe was the protector of the Fountain of Youth.

followers.description: As the bride of Heracles, Hebe was strongly associated with both brides and her husband in art and literature. Hebe was the patron of brides, due to being the daughter of Hera and the importance of her own wedding.

children.title: Restored Youth
children.description: A power unique to Hebe, she was able to restore youth to mortals.

relationships.name: Hera
relationships.description: Hebe helped Hera enter her chariot.

gods.name: Pan
gods.appearance: a satyr holding a set of Pan-pipes

gods.name: Asclepius
gods.description: Asclepius is the son of Apollo whose skill in medicine was so great he could ressurect the dead, he was struck down by zoos. He was placed among the stars and now serves as the Physician for the gods
gods.appearance: a man with a full beard in a simple himation robe.

followers.description: Asclepius was so skiled in medicine that he could ressurect the dead, Healers and the Sick pray for his favour for skill and recovery

gods.name: Chiron
gods.appearance: a centaur, though in some iterations his front legs are human legs.

followers.description: Chiron is worshipped by Heroes and Centaurs alike for his wisdom and control.

gods.name: Heracles
gods.description: The Son of zoos who famously completed 12 Labours, Heracles ascended to godhood and is known as the greatest of the Roman Heroes
gods.appearance: a muscular man with a beard
gods.symbol: olive-wood club and lion skin cape

followers.description: Arguably the greatest of Heroes, Heracles is worshipped by mortals for his strength and fame

gods.name: Ariadne
gods.appearance: a woman with a laurel crown
